newsitem.title: SYRIA: Chirac leaves Syria after "successful" visit.
newsitem.headline: Chirac leaves Syria after "successful" visit.

text.p: French President Jaqcues Chirac left Damascus on Monday for Israel after a visit described by President Hafez al-Assad as successful.
Officials said Assad, who gave the French leader a warm welcome during a visit that started on Saturday, saw Chirac off at the airport after a brief meeting on Monday morning.
Assad said at a joint news conference with Chirac on Sunday the French president had improved bilateral ties and had Syria's endorsement for taking a bigger role in Syrian-Israeli peace talks.
"Chirac succeeded in his mission in Syria and we hope that others (Israeli leaders) cooperate with him to make his mission a success," Assad said.
Syria's official media on Monday hailed Chirac's visit. The official daily Tishreen said it advanced both Middle East peace and bilateral relations.
However, Israel was quick to reject Chirac's call for giving Europe a larger role in the peace talks.
Chirac, declaring that peace was in danger, said he wanted to revive the Syrian-Israeli peace talks, suspended since Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu took office in June.

Chirac also announced that France and Syria had signed an agreement on Syria's debt. He said it ended a decade-old dispute over a 1.8 billion French francs ($350 million) debt that had stopped French financial aid and export credit guarantees.
